column4: should i use the debian sid installer or mozilla's for firefox 1.0.1?
i mean, if mozilla's works fine why bother
why not via apt-get ?
apparantly i dont have the right repositories because i cant find it
You are using synaptic?
yup
Settings -> Reposities -> Enable all the reposities and it should be ready to rock
all repositories are enabled =[
and ive added everything from ubuntuguide.org
You are using Hoary?
ah no sorry warty
sorry, dunno if it is in warty, BUT I cannot believe it is not. If it is not just go to the Ubuntu or Debian website and download the deb files. it can save you a lot of headache!
alright ill check it out. do you have the name of the firefox installer? i can google it
well i have the link if you give me one sec.
thanks

Again: you should be abled to find this yourself, bbut download what you think that you will need from this page: http://packages.debian.org/cgi-bin/search_packages.pl?keywords=firefox&searchon=names&subword=1&version=all&release=all
ya i found that before. i guess theres no ubuntu package?
actually im positive theres a backports firefox 1.0.1 package for warty
explain me the difference between a Debian and a Ubuntu package...
there was a thread about it
please do :x
ok thanks for the help. i wasnt sure if there was a difference
there is none. Both are .deb files. Sometimes Debian is not as updates as other distro's but do not worry... everything you download from Debian is stable and secure (that is for shure !!!!)
